hint_description: Typical draft: 1–3° for sand, 0.5–1° for permanent mold/HPDC; deep pockets and textured surfaces may need more.
check_items: Internal pockets and cores include draft ≥2–3°
Adequate release for bosses, ribs, deep cavities

hint_description: Minimize cores, ensure balanced fill, simplify machining fixturing.
check_items: Parting line chosen on largest, flattest plane
Core count minimized; core prints well-supported
No hidden undercuts requiring complex tooling
Ejection feasible without marking critical surfaces

hint_description: Target uniform walls; avoid abrupt changes. Typical min wall: sand 4–6 mm, die cast 2–3 mm.
check_items: Minimum wall thickness meets process capability
Thickness transitions gradual (≥1:3 taper or radii)
No isolated massive sections without cored relief
Ribs used to stiffen rather than thicken walls

hint_description: Generous fillets reduce stress and improve flow. Internal fillet ≥0.5× wall thickness.
check_items: Internal corners have fillets ≥0.5× wall thickness
External edges eased to avoid sand breakage/tool wear
T/L/X junctions relieved to prevent hotspots

hint_description: Identify heavy sections and provide directional solidification.
check_items: Hotspots identified (isolated bosses, thick hubs, junctions)

hint_description: Provide space for ingates, runners, vents; avoid direct impingement.
check_items: Ingate landing zones defined away from thin walls
Flow path avoids abrupt turns/stagnation pockets

hint_description: Provide machining stock and robust datum scheme.
check_items: Machining allowance specified per surface (e.g., 2–3 mm)
Tool access and cutter clearance verified

hint_description: Casting tolerances must align with process capability (ISO 8062).
check_items: Linear tolerances compatible with casting process
Geometric tolerances applied only where functional
Critical fits are machined or sleeved

hint_description: Prefer post-machined threads; boss aspect ratio height:OD = 1–2:1.
check_items: Cored holes sized for cleaning and draft (≥1–2°)

hint_description: Symmetry and uniform mass reduce warp and residual stress.
Specify realistic Ra; cast text height ≥0.5 mm, draft ≥1°.
check_items: Finish callouts per process (Ra on machined faces)
Cast text height ≥0.5 mm and draft ≥1°
No cosmetic requirements on hidden surfaces

hint_description: Design for safe handling, trimming, and recycling.

rule_header: Visualize the Casting in the Mold
hint_description: Create 3D drawings or small/full-scale models; study metal flow and solidification; help design cores, gates, risers, detect weaknesses
Account for metal shrinkage; heavier sections near risers; proper feeding to avoid porosity
Replace sharp angles with fillets/radii; minimize stress and heat concentration; avoid hot spots
Reduce junctions where multiple sections meet; stagger sections or use cored holes to prevent hot spots
Keep wall thickness uniform; heavy sections must be fed from risers
Inner walls ~0.9× outer walls; avoid rapid section changes to prevent porosity
Reduce stress, cracks, molding difficulty; fillet radius ≤0.5× section thickness
Adjoining sections ≤2:1 thickness ratio; use fillets or wedges for larger differences

rule_header: Maximize Design of Ribs and Brackets
hint_description: Ribs increase stiffness; avoid cross ribbing; taper brackets or cast separately
check_items: Avoid thin ribs on heavy sections

rule_header: Avoid Using Bosses, Lugs, and Pads
hint_description: Minimize bosses; blend fillets; use machining if possible; uniform wall thickness
